words: A word to the wise ain't necessary - it's the stupid ones that need the advice.
author: Bill Cosby

words: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.
author: Steve Martin

words: I feel sorry for people who don't drink. When they wake up in the morning, that's as good as they're going to feel all day.
author: Frank Sinatra

words: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

words: Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy.
author: Benjamin Franklin

words: Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please.
author: Mark Twain

words: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
author: George Bernard Shaw

words: Housework can't kill you, but why take a chance?
author: Phyllis Diller

words: All right everyone, line up alphabetically according to your height.
author: Casey Stengel

words: I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

words: I'm an idealist. I don't know where I'm going, but I'm on my way.
author: Carl Sandburg

words: It takes considerable knowledge just to realize the extent of your own ignorance.
If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts.
author: Albert Einstein

words: Everybody knows how to raise children, except the people who have them.
author: P. J. O'Rourke

words: A child of five would understand this. Send someone to fetch a child of five.
author: Groucho Marx

words: Do not worry about avoiding temptation. As you grow older it will avoid you.
author: Joey Adams

words: A nickel ain't worth a dime anymore.
author: Yogi Berra

words: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
author: Margaret Mead

words: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
author: George Burns

words: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
author: Douglas Adams

words: I used to be Snow White, but I drifted.
author: Mae West

words: I refuse to join any club that would have me as a member.
author: Groucho Marx

words: You can lead a man to Congress, but you can't make him think.
author: Milton Berle

words: If two wrongs don't make a right, try three.
author: Laurence J. Peter

words: If you're going to do something tonight that you'll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late.
author: Henny Youngman

words: I distrust camels, and anyone else who can go a week without a drink.
author: Joe E. Lewis

words: All generalizations are false, including this one.
author: Mark Twain

words: I'm sorry, if you were right, I'd agree with you.
author: Robin Williams

words: Be thankful we're not getting all the government we're paying for.
author: Will Rogers

words: Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
author: Don Marquis
